           <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite id="CITEREFRanju_Warrier2021" class="citation web cs1">Ranju Warrier (12 March 2021). <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://www.constructionweekonline.com/projects-and-tenders/271132-cggc-completes-main-works-at-kuwaits-al-mutlaa-residential-city-project">"CGGC completes main works at Kuwait's Al Mutlaa Residential City project"</a>. <i>Construction Week</i>.</cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.jtitle=Construction+Week&amp;rft.atitle=CGGC+completes+main+works+at+Kuwait%27s+Al+Mutlaa+Residential+City+project&amp;rft.date=2021-03-12&amp;rft.au=Ranju+Warrier&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.constructionweekonline.com%2Fprojects-and-tenders%2F271132-cggc-completes-main-works-at-kuwaits-al-mutlaa-residential-city-project&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AKuwait" class="Z3988"></span></span> </li>

         <li id="cite_note-auto-55"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-auto_55-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-auto_55-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text">
           <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite id="CITEREFWeekes2001" class="citation news cs1">Weekes, Richard (31 March 2001). <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/worldnews/middleeast/kuwait/1314980/Secrets-of-worlds-oldest-boat-are-discovered-in-Kuwait-sands.html">"Secrets of world's oldest boat are discovered in Kuwait sands"</a>. <i><a href="/wiki/The_Daily_Telegraph" title="The Daily Telegraph">The Daily Telegraph</a></i><span class="reference-accessdate">.            <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite id="CITEREFKilnerWallace1979" class="citation book cs1">Kilner, Peter; Wallace, Jonathan (1979). <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=vkosAQAAIAAJ&amp;q=built+a+Hellenistic+temple,+dedicated+to+Artemis+and+renamed+the+island+Ikaros+and+called+the+mainland+Larissa."><i>The Gulf Handbook - Volume 3</i></a>. p.&nbsp;344. <a href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" class="mw-redirect" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a>&nbsp;<a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/9780900751127" title="Special:BookSources/9780900751127"><bdi>9780900751127</bdi></a>.</cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=The+Gulf+Handbook+-+Volume+3&amp;rft.pages=344&amp;rft.date=1979&amp;rft.isbn=9780900751127&amp;rft.aulast=Kilner&amp;rft.aufirst=Peter&amp;rft.au=Wallace%2C+Jonathan&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fbooks.google.com%2Fbooks%3Fid%3DvkosAQAAIAAJ%26q%3Dbuilt%2Ba%2BHellenistic%2Btemple%2C%2Bdedicated%2Bto%2BArtemis%2Band%2Brenamed%2Bthe%2Bisland%2BIkaros%2Band%2Bcalled%2Bthe%2Bmainland%2BLarissa.&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AKuwait" class="Z3988"></span></span> </li> 
         <li id="cite_note-71"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-71">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">
           <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite id="CITEREFJalālzaʼī1991" class="citation book cs1">Jalālzaʼī, Mūsá Ḵh̲ān (1991). <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=Kt8rAAAAIAAJ&amp;q=Failaka+was+called+by+the+Greeks+Ikaros,+and+Kuwait+was+called+Larissa,+while+Bahrain+was+Tylos„as+provedby+the+famous+stone+of+Ikaros"><i>K̲h̲alīj aur bainulaqvāmī siyāsat</i></a>. p.&nbsp;34.</cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=K%CC%B2h%CC%B2al%C4%ABj+aur+bainulaqv%C4%81m%C4%AB+siy%C4%81sat&amp;rft.pages=34&amp;rft.date=1991&amp;rft.aulast=Jal%C4%81lza%CA%BC%C4%AB&amp;rft.aufirst=M%C5%ABs%C3%A1+%E1%B8%B4h%CC%B2%C4%81n&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fbooks.google.com%2Fbooks%3Fid%3DKt8rAAAAIAAJ%26q%3DFailaka%2Bwas%2Bcalled%2Bby%2Bthe%2BGreeks%2BIkaros%2C%2Band%2BKuwait%2Bwas%2Bcalled%2BLarissa%2C%2Bwhile%2BBahrain%2Bwas%2BTylos%E2%80%9Eas%2Bprovedby%2Bthe%2Bfamous%2Bstone%2Bof%2BIkaros&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AKuwait" class="Z3988"></span></span> </li>

         <li id="cite_note-christian-85"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-christian_85-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-christian_85-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text">
           <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite class="citation cs2">"Christianity in the Arab-Persian Gulf: an ancient but still obscure history", <i>Julie Bonnéric</i></cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Julie+Bonn%C3%A9ric&amp;rft.atitle=Christianity+in+the+Arab-Persian+Gulf%3A+an+ancient+but+still+obscure+history&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AKuwait" class="Z3988"></span></span> </li> 
         <li id="cite_note-nes-86"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-nes_86-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-nes_86-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-nes_86-2"><sup><i><b>c</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-nes_86-3"><sup><i><b>d</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-nes_86-4"><sup><i><b>e</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text">
           <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite class="citation web cs1"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.archaeology.org/issues/79-1303/features/kuwait/540-kuwait-failaka-christian-settlement">"Hidden Christian Community"</a>. <i><a href="/wiki/Archaeology_Magazine" class="mw-redirect" title="Archaeology Magazine">Archaeology Magazine</a></i><span class="reference-accessdate">.          <li id="cite_note-87"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-87">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">Vincent Bernard and Jean Francois Salles, "Discovery of a Christian Church at Al-Qusur, Failaka (Kuwait)," <i>Proceedings of the Seminar for Arabian Studies</i> 21 (1991), 7–21. Vincent Bernard, Olivier Callot and Jean Francois Salles, "L'eglise d'al-Qousour Failaka, Etat de Koweit," <i>Arabian Archaeology and Epigraphy</i> 2 (1991): 145–181.</span> </li> 
         <li id="cite_note-88"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-88">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">Yves Calvet, "Monuments paléo-chrétiens à Koweit et dans la région du Golfe," <i>Symposium Syriacum, Uppsala University, Department of Asian and African Languages, 11–14 August 1996</i>, <i><a href="/w/index.php?title=Orientalia_Christiana_Analecta&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Orientalia Christiana Analecta (page does not exist)">Orientalia Christiana Analecta</a></i> 256 (Rome, 1998), 671–673.</span> </li>

         <li id="cite_note-casey-105"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-casey_105-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-casey_105-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text">

         <li id="cite_note-106"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-106">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">
           <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite id="CITEREFAl-Jassar2009" class="citation thesis cs1">Al-Jassar, Mohammad Khalid A.            <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite id="CITEREFMichael_S._Casey2007" class="citation book cs1">Michael S.          <li id="cite_note-pioneer-151"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-pioneer_151-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-pioneer_151-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text">

         <li id="cite_note-health1-232"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-health1_232-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-health1_232-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-health1_232-2"><sup><i><b>c</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text">
           <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite class="citation web cs1"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://www.oxfordbusinessgroup.com/analysis/substantial-investment-series-mega-projects-are-set-boost-hospital-capacity">"Mega-projects boost hospital capacity in Kuwait"</a>. <i>Oxford Business Group</i>. 2016. <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20161220074237/https://www.oxfordbusinessgroup.com/analysis/substantial-investment-series-mega-projects-are-set-boost-hospital-capacity">Archived</a> from the original on 20 December 2016.</cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.jtitle=Oxford+Business+Group&amp;rft.atitle=Mega-projects+boost+hospital+capacity+in+Kuwait&amp;rft.date=2016&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.oxfordbusinessgroup.com%2Fanalysis%2Fsubstantial-investment-series-mega-projects-are-set-boost-hospital-capacity&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AKuwait" class="Z3988"></span></span> </li> 
         <li id="cite_note-health6-233"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-health6_233-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-health6_233-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text">
           <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite id="CITEREFAliIbrahemAl_MudafAl_Fadalah2018" class="citation journal cs1">Ali, Hayfaa; Ibrahem, Samaa Zenhom; Al Mudaf, Buthaina; Al Fadalah, Talal; Jamal, Diana; El-Jardali, Fadi (March 2018). <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="//www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC5840785">"Baseline assessment of patient safety culture in public hospitals in Kuwait"</a>. <i><a href="/wiki/BMC_Health_Services_Research" title="BMC Health Services Research">BMC Health Services Research</a></i>. <b>18</b> (1): 5. <a href="/wiki/Doi_(identifier)" class="mw-redirect" title="Doi (identifier)">doi</a>:<span class="cs1-lock-free" title="Freely accessible"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://doi.org/10.1186%2Fs12913-018-2960-x">10.1186/s12913-018-2960-x</a></span>. <a href="/wiki/ISSN_(identifier)" class="mw-redirect" title="ISSN (identifier)">ISSN</a>&nbsp;<a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="//www.worldcat.org/issn/1472-6963">1472-6963</a>. <a href="/wiki/PMC_(identifier)" class="mw-redirect" title="PMC (identifier)">PMC</a>&nbsp;<span class="cs1-lock-free" title="Freely accessible"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="//www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC5840785">5840785</a></span>. <a href="/wiki/PMID_(identifier)" class="mw-redirect" title="PMID (identifier)">PMID</a>&nbsp;<a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="//pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/29510705">29510705</a>. <q>There are 20 public hospitals in Kuwait</q></cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=BMC+Health+Services+Research&amp;rft.atitle=Baseline+assessment+of+patient+safety+culture+in+public+hospitals+in+Kuwait.&amp;rft.volume=18&amp;rft.issue=1&amp;rft.pages=5&amp;rft.date=2018-03&amp;rft_id=%2F%2Fwww.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov%2Fpmc%2Farticles%2FPMC5840785%23id-name%3DPMC&amp;rft.issn=1472-6963&amp;rft_id=info%3Apmid%2F29510705&amp;rft_id=info%3Adoi%2F10.1186%2Fs12913-018-2960-x&amp;rft.aulast=Ali&amp;rft.aufirst=Hayfaa&amp;rft.au=Ibrahem%2C+Samaa+Zenhom&amp;rft.au=Al+Mudaf%2C+Buthaina&amp;rft.au=Al+Fadalah%2C+Talal&amp;rft.au=Jamal%2C+Diana&amp;rft.au=El-Jardali%2C+Fadi&amp;rft_id=%2F%2Fwww.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov%2Fpmc%2Farticles%2FPMC5840785&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AKuwait"          <li id="cite_note-Fire_station-274"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-Fire_station_274-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">
           <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite class="citation web cs1"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://www.alraimedia.com/article/1531173/محليات/لقاءات-وتحقيقات/أكاديمية-الكويت-لعلوم-الإطفاء-الصرح-الثالث-على-مستوى-العالم">"أكاديمية الكويت لعلوم الإطفاء... الصرح الثالث على مستوى العالم"</a>. <i>Al Rai</i> (in Arabic). 18 April 2021. <q>بالإضافة إلى مركزي إطفاء بري وبحري في جزيرة بوبيان في ميناء مبارك، بالتعاون مع وزارة الأشغال</q></cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.jtitle=Al+Rai&amp;rft.atitle=%D8%A3%D9%83%D8%A7%D8%AF%D9%8A%D9%85%D9%8A%D8%A9+%D8%A7%D9%84%D9%83%D9%88%D9%8A%D8%AA+%D9%84%D8%B9%D9%84%D9%88%D9%85+%D8%A7%D9%84%D8%A5%D8%B7%D9%81%D8%A7%D8%A1...+%D8%A7%D9%84%D8%B5%D8%B1%D8%AD+%D8%A7%D9%84%D8%AB%D8%A7%D9%84%D8%AB+%D8%B9%D9%84%D9%89+%D9%85%D8%B3%D8%AA%D9%88%D9%89+%D8%A7%D9%84%D8%B9%D8%A7%D9%84%D9%85&amp;rft.date=2021-04-18&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.alraimedia.com%2Farticle%2F1531173%2F%D9%85%D8%AD%D9%84%D9%8A%D8%A7%D8%AA%2F%D9%84%D9%82%D8%A7%D8%A1%D8%A7%D8%AA-%D9%88%D8%AA%D8%AD%D9%82%D9%8A%D9%82%D8%A7%D8%AA%2F%D8%A3%D9%83%D8%A7%D8%AF%D9%8A%D9%85%D9%8A%D8%A9-%D8%A7%D9%84%D9%83%D9%88%D9%8A%D8%AA-%D9%84%D8%B9%D9%84%D9%88%D9%85-%D8%A7%D9%84%D8%A5%D8%B7%D9%81%D8%A7%D8%A1-%D8%A7%D9%84%D8%B5%D8%B1%D8%AD-%D8%A7%D9%84%D8%AB%D8%A7%D9%84%D8%AB-%D8%B9%D9%84%D9%89-%D9%85%D8%B3%D8%AA%D9%88%D9%89-%D8%A7%D9%84%D8%B9%D8%A7%D9%84%D9%85&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AKuwait" class="Z3988"></span></span> </li> 
         <li id="cite_note-275"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-275">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">

         <li id="cite_note-292"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-292">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">
           <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite id="CITEREFJacques_Descloitres2003" class="citation web cs1">Jacques Descloitres, MODIS Rapid Response Team (3 February 2003). <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://archive.org/details/VE-IMG-4987">"Mesopotamia"</a> – via Internet Archive.</cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.btitle=Mesopotamia&amp;rft.date=2003-02-03&amp;rft.aulast=Jacques+Descloitres&amp;rft.aufirst=MODIS+Rapid+Response+Team&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Farchive.org%2Fdetails%2FVE-IMG-4987&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AKuwait" class="Z3988"></span></span> </li> 
         <li id="cite_note-eu-293"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-eu_293-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">
           <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite id="CITEREFDeniz_BozkurtOmer_Lutfi_Sen2012" class="citation web cs1">Deniz Bozkurt; Omer Lutfi Sen (2012). <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://meetingorganizer.copernicus.org/EGU2011/EGU2011-11072.pdf">"Hydrological response of past and future climate changes in the Euphrates-Tigris Basin"</a> <span class="cs1-format">(PDF)</span>. p.&nbsp;1. <q>The Euphrates-Tigris Basin, covering areas in five countries (Turkey, Iraq, Syria, Iran and Kuwait), is a major water resource of the Middle East.</q></cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.btitle=Hydrological+response+of+past+and+future+climate+changes+in+the+Euphrates-Tigris+Basin&amp;rft.pages=1&amp;rft.date=2012&amp;rft.au=Deniz+Bozkurt&amp;rft.au=Omer+Lutfi+Sen&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fmeetingorganizer.copernicus.org%2FEGU2011%2FEGU2011-11072.pdf&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AKuwait" class="Z3988"></span></span> </li>

         <li id="cite_note-308"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-308">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">Polity gives it a score of −7<sup id="cite_ref-autocracy_306-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-autocracy-306">[306]</a></sup> which it categories as autocratic<sup id="cite_ref-307" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-307">[307]</a></sup></span> </li>

         <li id="cite_note-lse-310"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-lse_310-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">
           <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite class="citation web cs1"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://eprints.lse.ac.uk/65693/1/39_MichaelHerb.pdf">"The origins of Kuwait's National Assembly"</a> <span class="cs1-format">(PDF)</span>. <i><a href="/wiki/London_School_of_Economics" title="London School of Economics">London School of Economics</a></i>. p.&nbsp;7. <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20161116225625/http://eprints.lse.ac.uk/65693/1/39_MichaelHerb.pdf">Archived</a> <span class="cs1-format">(PDF)</span> from the original on 16 November 2016.</cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.jtitle=London+School+of+Economics&amp;rft.atitle=The+origins+of+Kuwait%27s+National+Assembly&amp;rft.pages=7&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Feprints.lse.ac.uk%2F65693%2F1%2F39_MichaelHerb.pdf&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AKuwait" class="Z3988"></span></span> </li>

         <li id="cite_note-hopkins-324"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-hopkins_324-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-hopkins_324-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text">
           <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite id="CITEREFHopkinsIbrahim1997" class="citation book cs1">Hopkins, Nicholas S.; Ibrahim, Saad Eddin, eds.          <li id="cite_note-325"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-325">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">
           <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite class="citation web cs1"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://www.academia.edu/27337551">"The Legal System of Kuwait: An Evaluation Of Its Applicability"</a>. academia.edu. p.&nbsp;4. <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20170806175845/http://www.academia.edu/27337551/THE_LEGAL_SYSTEM_OF_KUWAIT_AN_EVALUTION_OF_ITS_APPLICABILITY">Archived</a> from the original on 6 August 2017.</cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.btitle=The+Legal+System+of+Kuwait%3A+An+Evaluation+Of+Its+Applicability&amp;rft.pages=4&amp;rft.pub=academia.edu&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.academia.edu%2F27337551&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AKuwait" class="Z3988"></span></span> </li> 
         <li id="cite_note-326"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-326">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">
           <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite id="CITEREFMaddex2014" class="citation book cs1">Maddex, Robert L. (5 March 2014). <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=WqMAAwAAQBAJ&amp;pg=PA153"><i>Constitutions of the World</i></a>.          <li id="cite_note-worldbank-342"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-worldbank_342-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-worldbank_342-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://data.worldbank.org/indicator/NY.GDP.PCAP.PP.CD?order=wbapi_data_value_2014+wbapi_data_value+wbapi_data_value-last&amp;sort=desc">"GDP per capita, PPP (current international $)", World Development Indicators database</a> <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20170228194132/http://data.worldbank.org/indicator/NY.GDP.PCAP.PP.CD?order=wbapi_data_value_2014+wbapi_data_value+wbapi_data_value-last&amp;sort=desc">Archived</a> 28 February 2017 at the <a href="/wiki/Wayback_Machine" title="Wayback Machine">Wayback Machine</a>, World Bank.          <li id="cite_note-343"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-343">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://www.cia.gov/library/publications/the-world-factbook/rankorder/2004rank.html">GDP – per capita (PPP)</a> <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20070613004710/https://www.cia.gov/library/publications/the-world-factbook/rankorder/2004rank.html">Archived</a> 13 June 2007 at the <a href="/wiki/Wayback_Machine" title="Wayback Machine">Wayback Machine</a>, <a href="/wiki/The_World_Factbook" title="The World Factbook">The World Factbook</a>, Central Intelligence Agency.</span> </li>

         <li id="cite_note-wages-357"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-wages_357-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-wages_357-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-wages_357-2"><sup><i><b>c</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-wages_357-3"><sup><i><b>d</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-wages_357-4"><sup><i><b>e</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-wages_357-5"><sup><i><b>f</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-wages_357-6"><sup><i><b>g</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-wages_357-7"><sup><i><b>h</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-wages_357-8"><sup><i><b>i</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-wages_357-9"><sup><i><b>j</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-wages_357-10"><sup><i><b>k</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-wages_357-11"><sup><i><b>l</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-wages_357-12"><sup><i><b>m</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text">

         <li id="cite_note-405"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-405">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">
           <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite id="CITEREFAlhabib2010" class="citation thesis cs1">Alhabib, Mohammad E.          <li id="cite_note-406"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-406">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">
           <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite id="CITEREFDénes_Gazsi" class="citation web cs1">Dénes Gazsi. <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://www.stonybrook.edu/commcms/nacil/pdfs/abstracts/Gazsi_NACIL1.pdf">"The Persian Dialects of the Ajam in Kuwait"</a> <span class="cs1-format">(PDF)</span>. <i>The University of Iowa</i>.</cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.jtitle=The+University+of+Iowa&amp;rft.atitle=The+Persian+Dialects+of+the+Ajam+in+Kuwait&amp;rft.au=D%C3%A9nes+Gazsi&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.stonybrook.edu%2Fcommcms%2Fnacil%2Fpdfs%2Fabstracts%2FGazsi_NACIL1.pdf&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AKuwait" class="Z3988"></span></span> </li> 
         <li id="cite_note-407"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-407">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">

         <li id="cite_note-421"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-421">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">

         <li id="cite_note-omn-422"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-omn_422-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-omn_422-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text">
           <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite id="CITEREFAl_Mukrashi2015" class="citation news cs1">Al Mukrashi, Fahad (22 August 2015). <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://gulfnews.com/news/gulf/oman/omanis-turn-their-backs-on-local-dramas-1.1568086">"Omanis turn their backs on local dramas"</a>. <i>Gulf News</i>. <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20160425210746/http://gulfnews.com/news/gulf/oman/omanis-turn-their-backs-on-local-dramas-1.1568086">Archived</a> from the original on 25 April 2016. <q>Kuwait's drama industry tops other Gulf drama as it has very prominent actors and actresses, enough scripts and budgets, produces fifteen serials annually at least.</q></cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=Gulf+News&amp;rft.atitle=Omanis+turn+their+backs+on+local+dramas&amp;rft.date=2015-08-22&amp;rft.aulast=Al+Mukrashi&amp;rft.aufirst=Fahad&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fgulfnews.com%2Fnews%2Fgulf%2Foman%2Fomanis-turn-their-backs-on-local-dramas-1.1568086&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AKuwait" class="Z3988"></span></span> </li>

         <li id="cite_note-434"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-434">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">
           <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite id="CITEREFWatson2010" class="citation news cs1">Watson, Katie (18 December 2010). <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://www.bbc.com/news/entertainment-arts-12025499">"Reviving Kuwait's theatre industry"</a>. <i><a href="/wiki/BBC_News" title="BBC News">BBC News</a></i>. <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20141111041620/http://www.bbc.com/news/entertainment-arts-12025499">Archived</a> from the original on 11 November 2014.</cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=BBC+News&amp;rft.atitle=Reviving+Kuwait%27s+theatre+industry&amp;rft.date=2010-12-18&amp;rft.aulast=Watson&amp;rft.aufirst=Katie&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.bbc.com%2Fnews%2Fentertainment-arts-12025499&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AKuwait" class="Z3988"></span></span> </li> 
         <li id="cite_note-theat-435"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-theat_435-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-theat_435-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text">
           <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite id="CITEREFHerbertLeclercq2000" class="citation encyclopaedia cs1">Herbert, Ian; Leclercq, Nicole, eds. (2000). <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=TG2mP5KTDn8C&amp;pg=PA147">"An Account of the Theatre Seasons 1996–97, 1997–98 and 1998–99"</a>. <i>The World of Theatre</i> (2000&nbsp;ed.). London: Taylor &amp; Francis. p.&nbsp;147. <a href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" class="mw-redirect" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a>&nbsp;<a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-0-415-23866-3" title="Special:BookSources/978-0-415-23866-3"><bdi>978-0-415-23866-3</bdi></a>.</cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=bookitem&amp;rft.atitle=An+Account+of+the+Theatre+Seasons+1996%E2%80%9397%2C+1997%E2%80%9398+and+1998%E2%80%9399&amp;rft.btitle=The+World+of+Theatre&amp;rft.place=London&amp;rft.pages=147&amp;rft.edition=2000&amp;rft.pub=Taylor+%26+Francis&amp;rft.date=2000&amp;rft.isbn=978-0-415-23866-3&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fbooks.google.com%2Fbooks%3Fid%3DTG2mP5KTDn8C%26pg%3DPA147&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AKuwait" class="Z3988"></span></span> </li> 
         <li id="cite_note-436"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-436">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">
           <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite id="CITEREFRubin1999" class="citation encyclopaedia cs1">Rubin, Don, ed. (1999). <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=W63OCzel54IC&amp;pg=PA132">"Kuwait"</a>. <i>The World Encyclopedia of Contemporary Theatre</i>.          <li id="cite_note-437"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-437">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">
           <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite id="CITEREFAlhajri" class="citation thesis cs1">Alhajri, Khalifah Rashed. <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://etheses.whiterose.ac.uk/793/1/uk_bl_ethos_487699.pdf"><i>A Scenographer's Perspective on Arabic Theatre and Arab-Muslim Identity</i></a> <span class="cs1-format">(PDF)</span> (PhD). Leeds, UK: <a href="/wiki/University_of_Leeds" title="University of Leeds">University of Leeds</a>. p.&nbsp;207. <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20170304041302/http://etheses.whiterose.ac.uk/793/1/uk_bl_ethos_487699.pdf">Archived</a> <span class="cs1-format">(PDF)</span> from the original on 4 March 2017<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">19 March</span> 2021</span>.</cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Adissertation&amp;rft.title=A+Scenographer%27s+Perspective+on+Arabic+Theatre+and+Arab-Muslim+Identity&amp;rft.inst=University+of+Leeds&amp;rft.aulast=Alhajri&amp;rft.aufirst=Khalifah+Rashed&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fetheses.whiterose.ac.uk%2F793%2F1%2Fuk_bl_ethos_487699.pdf&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AKuwait" class="Z3988"></span></span> </li> 
         <li id="cite_note-thae-438"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-thae_438-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-thae_438-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text">
           <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite class="citation news cs1"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20160505143238/https://www.y-oman.com/2013/07/shooting-the-past/">"Shooting the Past"</a>. <i>y-oman.com</i>. 11 July 2013. Archived from <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://www.y-oman.com/2013/07/shooting-the-past/">the original</a> on 5 May 2016<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">22 April</span> 2016</span>. <q>Most Omanis who get to study drama abroad tend to go to Kuwait or Egypt. In the Gulf, Kuwait has long been a pioneer in theatre, film and television since the establishment of its Higher Institute of Dramatic Arts (HIDA) in 1973. By contrast, there is no drama college or film school in Oman, although there is a drama course at Sultan Qaboos University.</q></cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=article&amp;rft.jtitle=y-oman.com&amp;rft.atitle=Shooting+the+Past&amp;rft.date=2013-07-11&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.y-oman.com%2F2013%2F07%2Fshooting-the-past%2F&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AKuwait" class="Z3988"></span></span> </li> 
         <li id="cite_note-439"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-439">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">

         <li id="cite_note-450"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-450">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">
           <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite class="citation web cs1"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://reconnectingarts.com/2017/01/29/egyptian-artist-fatma-talks-about-the-gateway-to-human-faces-and-equality-for-all/">"Egyptian Artist Fatma, talks about the gateway to human faces and equality for all"</a>.            <link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r999302996"><cite class="citation web cs1"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://www.freedomhouse.org/sites/default/files/FOTP2010--Final%20Booklet_5May.pdf">"Freedom of the Press 2010"</a> <span class="cs1-format">(PDF)</span>. p.&nbsp;25. <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20161011005714/https://www.freedomhouse.org/sites/default/files/FOTP2010--Final%20Booklet_5May.pdf">Archived</a> <span class="cs1-format">(PDF)</span> from the original on 11 October 2016.</cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.btitle=Freedom+of+the+Press+2010&amp;rft.pages=25&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.freedomhouse.org%2Fsites%2Fdefault%2Ffiles%2FFOTP2010--Final%2520Booklet_5May.pdf&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3AKuwait" class="Z3988"></span></span> </li> 
         <li id="cite_note-501"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-501">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">

        <li style="min-height:31px"><span style="display:inline-block;width:31px;line-height:31px;vertical-align:middle;text-align:center"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/0/06/Wiktionary-logo-v2.svg/27px-Wiktionary-logo-v2.svg.png" decoding="async" width="27" height="27" style="vertical-align: middle" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/0/06/Wiktionary-logo-v2.svg/41px-Wiktionary-logo-v2.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/0/06/Wiktionary-logo-v2.svg/54px-Wiktionary-logo-v2.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="391" data-file-height="391"></span><span style="display:inline-block;margin-left:4px;width:182px;vertical-align:middle"><a href="https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/Special:Search/Kuwait" class="extiw" title="wikt:Special:Search/Kuwait">Definitions</a> from Wiktionary</span></li>
        <li style="min-height:31px"><span style="display:inline-block;width:31px;line-height:31px;vertical-align:middle;text-align:center"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/4/4a/Commons-logo.svg/20px-Commons-logo.svg.png" decoding="async" width="20" height="27" style="vertical-align: middle" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/4/4a/Commons-logo.svg/30px-Commons-logo.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/4/4a/Commons-logo.svg/40px-Commons-logo.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="1024" data-file-height="1376"></span><span style="display:inline-block;margin-left:4px;width:182px;vertical-align:middle"><a href="https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/%D8%A7%D9%84%D9%83%D9%88%D9%8A%D8%AA" class="extiw" title="c:الكويت">Media</a> from Wikimedia Commons</span></li>
        <li style="min-height:31px"><span style="display:inline-block;width:31px;line-height:31px;vertical-align:middle;text-align:center"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/24/Wikinews-logo.svg/27px-Wikinews-logo.svg.png" decoding="async" width="27" height="15" style="vertical-align: middle" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/24/Wikinews-logo.svg/41px-Wikinews-logo.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/24/Wikinews-logo.svg/54px-Wikinews-logo.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="759" data-file-height="415"></span><span style="display:inline-block;margin-left:4px;width:182px;vertical-align:middle"><a href="https://en.wikinews.org/wiki/Category:Kuwait" class="extiw" title="n:Category:Kuwait">News</a> from Wikinews</span></li>
        <li style="min-height:31px"><span style="display:inline-block;width:31px;line-height:31px;vertical-align:middle;text-align:center"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/f/fa/Wikiquote-logo.svg/23px-Wikiquote-logo.svg.png" decoding="async" width="23" height="27" style="vertical-align: middle" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/f/fa/Wikiquote-logo.svg/35px-Wikiquote-logo.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/f/fa/Wikiquote-logo.svg/46px-Wikiquote-logo.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="300" data-file-height="355"></span><span style="display:inline-block;margin-left:4px;width:182px;vertical-align:middle"><a href="https://en.wikiquote.org/wiki/Kuwait" class="extiw" title="q:Kuwait">Quotations</a> from Wikiquote</span></li>
        <li style="min-height:31px"><span style="display:inline-block;width:31px;line-height:31px;vertical-align:middle;text-align:center"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/4c/Wikisource-logo.svg/26px-Wikisource-logo.svg.png" decoding="async" width="26" height="27" style="vertical-align: middle" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/4c/Wikisource-logo.svg/39px-Wikisource-logo.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/4c/Wikisource-logo.svg/51px-Wikisource-logo.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="410" data-file-height="430"></span><span style="display:inline-block;margin-left:4px;width:182px;vertical-align:middle"><a href="https://en.wikisource.org/wiki/Special:Search/Kuwait" class="extiw" title="s:Special:Search/Kuwait">Texts</a> from Wikisource</span></li>

                    </ul></li>

                    </ul></li>

                   <li><a href="/wiki/Yemen" title="Yemen">Yemen</a></li>
                  </ul> 
                 </div></td>
                <td class="noviewer navbox-image" rowspan="4" style="width:1px;padding:0px 0px 0px 2px">

                  <a href="/wiki/File:Middle_East_(orthographic_projection).svg" class="image"><img alt="Middle East (orthographic projection).svg" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/3/3f/Middle_East_%28orthographic_projection%29.svg/70px-Middle_East_%28orthographic_projection%29.svg.png" decoding="async" width="70" height="70" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/3/3f/Middle_East_%28orthographic_projection%29.svg/105px-Middle_East_%28orthographic_projection%29.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/3/3f/Middle_East_%28orthographic_projection%29.svg/140px-Middle_East_%28orthographic_projection%29.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="553" data-file-height="553"></a>
                 </div></td>
               </tr>

               <tr>
                <th scope="row" class="navbox-group" style="width:1%">Geopolitical history</th>
                <td class="navbox-list navbox-odd hlist" style="text-align:left;border-left-width:2px;border-left-style:solid;width:100%;padding:0px">
                 <div style="padding:0em 0.25em"> 
                  <ul>
                   <li><a href="/wiki/Gulf_War" title="Gulf War">Gulf War</a></li> 
                   <li><a href="/wiki/Iran%E2%80%93Saudi_Arabia_proxy_conflict" title="Iran–Saudi Arabia proxy conflict">Iran–Saudi Arabia proxy conflict</a></li> 
                   <li><a href="/wiki/Bahraini_uprising_of_2011" title="Bahraini uprising of 2011">Bahraini uprising of 2011</a> 
                    <ul>
                     <li><a href="/wiki/Saudi-led_intervention_in_Bahrain" title="Saudi-led intervention in Bahrain">Saudi-led intervention in Bahrain</a></li>
                    </ul></li> 
                   <li><a href="/wiki/Qatar%E2%80%93Saudi_Arabia_diplomatic_conflict" title="Qatar–Saudi Arabia diplomatic conflict">Qatar–Saudi Arabia diplomatic conflict</a> 
                    <ul>
                     <li><a href="/wiki/Qatar_diplomatic_crisis" title="Qatar diplomatic crisis">Qatar diplomatic crisis</a></li>
                    </ul></li>

                  </ul> 
                 </div></td>
               </tr>
               <tr>
                <th scope="row" class="navbox-group" style="width:1%">Sport</th>
                <td class="navbox-list navbox-even hlist" style="text-align:left;border-left-width:2px;border-left-style:solid;width:100%;padding:0px">
